channel.title: Comments on: Nest Update #12: Software at 3.0 with New Features

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1749/comment-page-1#comment-24055">Don</a>.
I haven't checked. No one has opened any issues on GitHub for the NodeJS wrapper. Unless they force users to upgrade mobile clients or use some other trick, in theory, it should still work.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Don.

I haven’t checked. No one has opened any issues on GitHub for the NodeJS wrapper. Unless they force users to upgrade mobile clients or use some other trick, in theory, it should still work.

item.title: By: Don
item.dc:creator: Don
item.description: Has the API changed as a result of the most recent software update (Late April/Early May 2013) ????
item.content:encoded: Has the API changed as a result of the most recent software update (Late April/Early May 2013) ????

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1749/comment-page-1#comment-23993">Alex</a>.
No, it's not available in any general location that I'm aware of. You called Support and they don't answer?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Alex.

No, it’s not available in any general location that I’m aware of. You called Support and they don’t answer?

item.title: By: Alex
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: for some reason they do not answer me. So it is impossible to download file somewhere online? Thanx
item.content:encoded: for some reason they do not answer me. So it is impossible to download file somewhere online? Thanx

item.content:encoded:
In reply to Alex.

Alex — I think if you call support, they can provide it.

item.title: By: Alex

item.content:encoded:

item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1749/comment-page-1#comment-22367">William</a>.
Are you asking about installing it from scratch somehow (rather than just a patch)?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to William.

Are you asking about installing it from scratch somehow (rather than just a patch)?

item.title: By: William
item.dc:creator: William
item.description: Hi there, I followed your blog posts quite some time and consider a must read. Maybe you can help with this one: Do you know how to install software manually for the Nest through the USB cable. There are packages on http://www.nest.com/ca/legal/compliance/ that look like linux system files. Can I download those packages to my PC and install then through USB in my Nest? FYI: I received the Nest for free (can't disclose why and for what because of leagal reasons, sorry about that) and the tech guys taking care of my buggy Nest are slow to respond or maybe overworked =). I don't care about messing up the Nest as it is already messed up LOL. Or is it too complicated too accomplish that? I am not a programmer BTW. Looking forward to your feedack!
item.content:encoded: Hi there, I followed your blog posts quite some time and consider a must read. Maybe you can help with this one: Do you know how to install software manually for the Nest through the USB cable. There are packages on http://www.nest.com/ca/legal/compliance/ that look like linux system files. Can I download those packages to my PC and install then through USB in my Nest? FYI: I received the Nest for free (can’t disclose why and for what because of leagal reasons, sorry about that) and the tech guys taking care of my buggy Nest are slow to respond or maybe overworked =). I don’t care about messing up the Nest as it is already messed up LOL. Or is it too complicated too accomplish that? I am not a programmer BTW. Looking forward to your feedack!

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1749/comment-page-1#comment-21381">matt howard</a>.
The rumor you heard is absolutely not true if you're using a traditional HVAC system. There are some differences if you use a geo-thermal system in terms of recovery time, etc. I don't know about other types of systems other than forced air. It's common to recommend people set back their thermostats at night more than 5 degrees.
Every winter night, we set our thermostat back 10 degrees for 8 hours.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to matt howard.

The rumor you heard is absolutely not true if you’re using a traditional HVAC system. There are some differences if you use a geo-thermal system in terms of recovery time, etc. I don’t know about other types of systems other than forced air. It’s common to recommend people set back their thermostats at night more than 5 degrees.

Every winter night, we set our thermostat back 10 degrees for 8 hours.

item.title: By: matt howard
item.dc:creator: matt howard
item.description:
Aaron,
I'm just stopping in to thank you for your blog. I received my nest 2.0 a couple months ago and truly love it. Lord knows I would have ended up with the 1.0 version with all its headaches if it were not for you!
Heard something that was alarming the other day, have you ever heard that it is bad for your furnace if you keep it off all day and then turn it on where it needs to catch up by more than 5 degrees?
Thanks again!
item.content:encoded:
Aaron,

I’m just stopping in to thank you for your blog. I received my nest 2.0 a couple months ago and truly love it. Lord knows I would have ended up with the 1.0 version with all its headaches if it were not for you!

Heard something that was alarming the other day, have you ever heard that it is bad for your furnace if you keep it off all day and then turn it on where it needs to catch up by more than 5 degrees?

Thanks again!
